duties_responsibilities.duty: Develop and lead outreach activities and educational opportunities in partnership with the Executive Director, Chapter Presidents, and Board of Directors.
Serve as District Lobby Days staff lead, organizing events, volunteers, and programming.
Develop and build a comprehensive volunteer engagement platform through the chapters and meet outreach and volunteer engagement goals.
Serve as staff lead to the annual fundraiser volunteer committee, providing material support and assistance in implementing committee plans.
Collaborate with the marketing and communications team to increase visibility and promote programs and events.
Work within budget to ensure that the outreach initiatives and development events are fiscally responsible.
Work with Ambassadors and Chapter leadership teams to ensure effective marketing, outreach, and legislative support and serve as a Liaison to the Executive Director.

Assess opportunities for new chapters and dissolve unproductive chapters while maintaining legislative/constituent support in those areas that may not have the resources to qualify as a "THLN Chapter."
Develop an annual plan with each chapter: set financial goals, determine fundraising programs, and develop a tactical plan for accomplishing goals.
Maintain the Ambassador Handbook and Chapter Handbook.
Perform other duties as assigned by the Executive Director.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree required. Five to seven years of experience in community initiatives may be accepted in lieu of a degree.
